settingsPane.description: CPU SETTINGS
settingsPane.name: CPU Scaling Settings

seekBar.description: Scaling maximum frequency.ALERT! 1.9 and 2.16 GHz can be unstable for your personal device! Try it and if the phone stuck (SOD), then your CPU will not work on such high frequency and you have to use a lower value! 2.16 Ghz is unstable on 85% of devices, try at your own risk. (Samsung default: 1600000)
seekBar.name: scaling_max_freq

settingsPane.description: Here you can set all the settings for power save!
settingsPane.name: CPU Idle and Power Settings

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. For best stability use Idle + LPA. (Default: AFTR + LPA)
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of ondemand and pegasusq governors.
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load. It sets the the load threshold on which BUS frequency will rise. (Default: 25%)
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

seekBar.description: Maximum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. Samsung default value is 800000kHz. Setting this too low will stuck your device!
seekBar.name: scaling_max_suspend_freq

seekBar.description: Minimum DEEP SLEEP CPU speed. (Default: 200.000 kHz)
seekBar.name: scaling_min_suspend_freq

settingsPane.description: GOVERNOR SETTINGS
settingsPane.name: CPU Governor Settings

spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: This will detect the current CPU governor and apply a profile for it. Works for all governors except zzmoove (settings below), performance, powersave and userspace governors.
spinner.name: Governor Profiles

spinner.description: This will apply a profile for zzmoove governor if it is active. Check kernel thread for more info on profiles.
spinner.name: zzmoove Profiles

settingsPane.description: CPU Voltage Controls. Voltage Range is 600~1500mV. Lower or higher are NOT SUPPORTED. All is done to prevent BUGS and SODS. USE this interface AT YOUR OWN RISK! If you get SOD before you can load this interface and cannot fix your error, reflash kernel from recovery. And think harder before you SOD your CPU with too much UV or OV!.
settingsPane.name: CPU Voltage Controls

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency Settings. Default frequencies are 108, 160, 200, 440 and 533. Voltage defaults are 925mV, 925mV, 950mV, 1050 and 1125mV.
settingsPane.name: GPU FREQUENCY

checkbox.description: Multisample anti-aliasing can improve image quality of some 3D games.
checkbox.name: Multisample anti-aliasing
checkbox.label: 4x MSAA

spinner.description: Changes the first GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

spinner.description: Changes the fourth GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step4

spinner.description: Changes the fifth GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step5

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 850, 850, 900 and 950. WARNING: Too low voltages can cause freezes, and freezes can cause data corruption! Undervolting limits can vary from device to device.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level4

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level5

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from third to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fourth to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from fourth to fifth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 4-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from fifth to fourth step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 5-DOWN

settingsPane.description: TouckWake Settings
settingsPane.name: TouchWake Settings

checkbox.description: TouchWake/DoubleTap2Wake On or Off Switch! Timeout must be set to 0 for Double Tap and Slide2wake must be off
checkbox.name: TouchWake
checkbox.label: TouchWake

checkbox.description: When screen is turned off, swipe from the left side of the screen to the right side of the screen, and the screen will be turned on! Touchwake Timout must be set to 0 for this to work
checkbox.name: Slide2Wake
checkbox.label: Slide2Wake

settingsPane.description: TouchBoost Control
settingsPane.name: TouchBoost Control

checkbox.description: TouchBoost On or Off Switch
checkbox.name: TouchBoost
checkbox.label: TouchBoost

settingsPane.description: Here you can control kernel screen gestures, set at data - gesture_set.sh. More can be added by user !!!
settingsPane.name: Gestures panel

checkbox.description: Here you can turn on or off kernel built in gestures! See OP for instructions or ask in forum.
checkbox.name: Gestures switch
checkbox.label: Gestures switch

checkbox.description: This will enable or disable the Gesture Booster for use with kernel gestures.
checkbox.name: Gesture Booster
checkbox.label: Gesture Booster

settingsPane.description: Here you can change mDNIe (Mobile Digital Natural Image Engine). If you are using cyanogenmod then enable this in rom's advanced display settings.
settingsPane.name: MDNIE Control

seekBar.description: By increasing this you will get warmer colors (good for night). Has no effect when Scenario is set to 0.
seekBar.name: Mode

checkbox.description: MDNIE Negative Switch
checkbox.name: Negative
checkbox.label: MDNIE Negative Switch

settingsPane.description: This is the Master Control switch for Boeffla Sound. The settings below will do nothing if this isn't enabled!
settingsPane.name: Boeffla Sound Switch

checkbox.description: Boeffla Sound On or Off Switch
checkbox.name: BoefflaSound
checkbox.label: BoefflaSound

settingsPane.description: Speaker Sound Amplification
settingsPane.name: Speaker Volume Gain

seekBar.description: Master volume, gain power level, affects all channels
seekBar.name: Speaker volume gain

settingsPane.description: Headphone Amplification Settings
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

settingsPane.description: Microphone Amplification Settings
settingsPane.name: Microphone Amplification

seekBar.description: Microphone Amplifier Level (Used to increase or decrease volume during calls)
seekBar.name: Microphone In Call Amplifier

seekBar.description: Microphone Amplifier Level (Used to increase or decrease volume during calls)
seekBar.name: Microphone General Amplifier

settingsPane.description: Touchkeys Settings. Disable any touchkeys configurations your ROM might have to use these.
settingsPane.name: Touch Keys

checkbox.description: Selecting this will force disable touchkeys no matter what settings are set below.
checkbox.name: Force Disable Touchkeys
checkbox.label: Force Disable Touchkeys

settingsPane.description: Here you can find some settings and options for your apps.
settingsPane.name: Apps

button.description: Click here to start fixing. Here you can run Fix Permissions, please click one time only, scripts will finish in max 2~3min, no reboot is needed.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: FIX PERMISSIONS

button.description: Click here to start Zipaligning ONLY user apps. System may be unresponsive, it is OK, do not use phone for 2 minutes. WARNING! Backup all user applications before use! This process will remove applications that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. USE it AT YOUR OWN RISK, and update the broken applications!.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start applications Database Optimization. Compacting, cleaning and indexing will take max 2min.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

settingsPane.description: These settings control memory settings. Keep in mind that these settings give you 'more' memory at the cost of CPU cycles, which means less battery. A restart is recommended when changing memory settings.
settingsPane.name: Memory Settings

checkbox.description: Check this to enable Zswap. Don't disable this if your memory is almost full, free some memory before disabling.
checkbox.name: ZSWAP
checkbox.label: ZSWAP

seekBar.description: Use this to set swappiness level.
seekBar.name: ZSWAP LEVEL

checkbox.description: Enable AUTO OOM control using below profiles, disable if you want to set your own OOM tuning via APP or Script.
checkbox.name: Auto OOM
checkbox.label: AUTO OOM CONTROL

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive, equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen ON

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low mem management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM but more killed apps.
spinner.name: OOM Level Screen OFF

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 15%)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background ratio

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer, more you set, more memory will be used for write buffer for real time operations. Buffer is released on need to free RAM (Default: 20%)
seekBar.name: Dirty ratio

checkbox.description: This will enable Kernel Same-page Merging. KSM is a kernel thread that runs in the background and compares pages in memory, if two pages are found to be the same, the KSM thread merges them back as a single copy-on-write page of memory, thus freeing memory.
checkbox.name: KSM
checkbox.label: KSM

checkbox.description: This will enable kernel Dynamic sync file sync control
checkbox.name: DynamicFsync
checkbox.label: DynamicFsync

settingsPane.description: These settings control FS options.
settingsPane.name: FS Settings

seekBar.description: Read-ahead buffer size for sdcard. Optimal value varies with sdcard size and file system used. Default is 128KB.
seekBar.name: Read-ahead buffer

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

button.description: DATA, SYSTEM and CACHE file system check and repair on boot. !WARNING! This is a VERY DANGEROUS option! Before activating it DO A FULL BACKUP with Titanium Backup or any kind of backup application! If you have lots of damage in your DATA partition, after fix and repair, ROM may NOT BOOT anymore! In that case reinstall ROM, and if you still cannot boot, you will have to format DATA file system via recovery! USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! THIS FUNCTION IS NOT A TOY! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! This function works only for main ROM and Preload partition !also can be the second ROM system!, second ROM data gets no effect, and by default function is OFF. It is also one time action, push the button to Activate, push again to Abort!
button.name: FIX File System on BOOT
button.label: FIX DATA ON or OFF

checkbox.description: Check and repair file system on every boot by auto. See the WARNING ABOVE! DO FULL BACKUP! this is the same thing! just every boot! if all clean then should be OK, Doesn't clean dalvik-cache
checkbox.name: Check and repair file system on every boot
checkbox.label: Check and repair file system on every boot

button.description: Clean the media cache on your sdcard. Push once to clean, push again to abort. You have to reboot for action to work!
button.name: Clean media-cache
button.label: FIX MEDIA ON or OFF

settingsPane.description: Show Storage status, you can see if you have errors in system, data, cache, efs or preloaded partitions, this will only SHOW if all OK, or there are errors! will not fix them.
settingsPane.name: Partitions Scan

button.description: Use this to check your data, system, cache, efs, and preloaded partitions for errors. This will not FIX any errors, just check! To fix, backup your files with some backups app, then push the data and cache fix button located at OTHER TAB. USE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK! Some data will be lost! You will need to restore broken apps + data, in case of boot loop, then reinstall ROM. If you are still stuck on boot, wipe and install thr ROM again! It is BETTER to have a clean partition then broken and unstable system.
button.name: Partition Status
button.label: Partition Status

settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Only give sleepers 50% of their service deficit. This allows them to run sooner, but does not allow tons of sleepers to rip the spread apart.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH_POWER enables the use of arm topology power functions instead of generic ones.
checkbox.name: ARCH_POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH_POWER

settingsPane.description: Charger, Battery settings and options. allowed mA is in range from 475mA to 700mA, by hardware limits! we cant set less or more
settingsPane.name: Battery Charge

settingsPane.description: These settings control misc kernel and ROM tweaks.
settingsPane.name: MISC tweaks

seekBar.description: This controls vibration level. If you are using CM11 use the ROM vibration control. Default is 50%. Warning: levels above 75% might be dangerous.
seekBar.name: Vibration Level

spinner.description: Set GPS tweaks based on your location. You can also copy your custom GPS configuration to /data/gps.conf then set to Off/Custom, your custom configuration will be applied at every boot and will survive rom flashing.
spinner.name: GPS Tweaks

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

settingsPane.description: WIFI Settings
settingsPane.name: WIFI

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the button to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: USB and SDCARD settings and options.
settingsPane.name: USB - SDCARD

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or MTP.
spinner.name: USB mass storage mode

button.description: Dual Mount-SDCARD and MMC via USB. After USB is disconnected, Dual Mount is disabled! This tweak is working automatically. Plug USB, turn off the screen and then turn ON, and you get working mounts. To scan your new MEDIA files, use some app to force Media Scan.
button.name: DUAL MOUNT
button.label: Dual Mount

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Navigation Bar (needs restart)
checkbox.name: Navigation Bar
checkbox.label: Navigation Bar

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

checkbox.description: If checked, BetterBatteryStatus will report discrete (non-overlapping) wakelock statistics.
checkbox.name: Discrete Wakelock Stats
checkbox.label: Discrete Wakelock Stats

settingsPane.description: Removing/Reinstalling root to support some apps which requires you not to have a rooted phone.
settingsPane.name: Remove/Reinstall Root

button.description: Root check. Click to see if you have ROOT or not
button.name: ROOT Check
button.label: ROOT CHECK

button.description: Removes su and Superuser.apk files from the system partition
button.name: Remove Root
button.label: Remove Root

checkbox.description: If checked, installs root on the next reboot.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose optional kernel modules. If you don't know what they mean then there is no point in enabling them. Needs restart.
settingsPane.name: Optional Modules

checkbox.description: This enables SMB/CIFS/NFS Network Modules. These modules are responsible for managing your network shares. It is used to mount/unmount network file resources on to your device.
checkbox.name: SMB/CIFS/NFS Network Modules
checkbox.label: SMB/CIFS/NFS Network Modules

checkbox.description: SCSI Scan Wait is responsible to wait until all the asynchronous scans are complete. It will wait after all root SCSI drivers have finished scanning their busses. Note that use of this module can increase your bootup time.
checkbox.name: Small Computer System Interface Wait Scan
checkbox.label: SCSI Wait Scan

settingsPane.description: You can check what profile is used right now.
settingsPane.name: Online Profile

button.description: This displays your currently used profile.
button.name: Profile Check
button.label: Profile Check

settingsPane.description: Here you can choose some profiles. You can also switch the default profiles (battery, default, performance) via Kernel-Recovery.
settingsPane.name: STweaks Profiles

settingsPane.description: Here you can backup or restore your profile after installing new kernel. When you restore your configuration, please wait till this app restarts with the new settings. Some settings will work only after reboot! Restore will take up to 30 sec, just wait here!
settingsPane.name: STweaks Settings Backup or Restore

button.description: This will restore stweaks settings to default. Restart the device after pressing the button.
button.name: Reset Stweaks Settings
button.label: Reset Settings

settingsPane.description: Warning: No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons.
settingsPane.name: Dual Boot Settings

checkbox.description: Check this if you don't want boot menu to be shown. If this options is checked, boot menu will not be shown even if you have 2nd ROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-menu
checkbox.label: No boot-menu

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you don't have 2nd ROM installation 1st ROM will be booted.
spinner.name: Default ROM

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card sdcard
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report
